document.docAuthor: Zhang, Bao-Shi, Liu, Long & Zhang, Feng
document.masterDocTitle: The cobweb spiders of the genus Anelosimus Simon, 1891 (Araneae: Theridiidae) in Hainan Island, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The cobweb spiders of the genus Anelosimus Simon, 1891 (Araneae: Theridiidae) in Hainan Island, China

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Theridion seximaculatum
Zhu, 1998
: 141
, f. 84 A – C;
Song, Zhu & Chen, 1999
: 142
, f. 79 G – H.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Female holotype and
2 female
paratypes , from Jianfengling Mountain ( 19 °07ʹN, 109 ° 13 ʹE), Hainan Island, China ,
15 August 1990
, M. B. Gu leg., examined.

Other material examined. Hainan Province: Bawangling Mountain ( 19 °07ʹN, 109 °04ʹE),
2 males
and
3 females
,
31 July 2007
, C. Zhang leg.;
6 females
,
8 November 2008
, G. X. Han leg.;
3 males
and
11 females
,
22 May 2009
, C. Zhang leg.;
4 males
and
8 females
,
25 May 2009
, C. Zhang leg.; Yajia village,
2 males
and
6 females
,
19 May 2009
, C. Zhang leg.; Wuzhi Mountain ( 18 ° 39 ʹN, 109 ° 19 ʹE),
2 males
and
3 females
,
16 August 2007
, F. Zhang leg.;
4 females
,
17 November 2008
, G. X. Han leg.;
2 males
and
12 females
,
23 November 2008
, G. X. Han leg.; Limu Mountain ( 19 ° 10 ʹN, 109 ° 39 ʹE),
7 females
,
21 July 2008
, G. X. Han leg.; Jianfengling Mountain,
9 females
,
12 November 2008
, G. X. Han leg.;
11 females
,
31 May 2009
, C. Zhang leg.; Diaoluo Mountain ( 18 ° 45 ʹN, 109 ° 45 ʹE),
8 females
,
5 June 2009
, C. Zhang leg.; Baoting County, Qixianling Mountain ( 18 ° 14 ʹN, 109 ° 37 ʹE),
1 female
,
8 June 2009
, C. Zhang leg.

Diagnosis. Males can be distinguished from all other
Anelosimus
species except
A. kohi
Yoshida, 1993
by the simple, short embolus. It differs from
A. kohi
by the shape of embolic base and the embolic origination (
Figs 11– 12
). Females can be distinguished from all other
Anelosimus
species except
A. linda
and
A. membranaceus
by the short and straight copulatory ducts, and differ from
A. linda
and
A. membranaceus
by having only one copulatory opening (
Figs
13 – 14
).
Description. Male (from Jianfengling Mountain), total length 1.71 : prosoma 0.81 long, 0.68 wide; opisthosoma 1.12 long, 0.90 wide.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 10–14.
Anelosimus seximaculatum
(Zhu, 1998)
n. comb. 10 – 12, male. 10, body, dorsal view; 11, male left palp, ventral view; 12, same, prolateral view; 13 – 14, female. 13, epigynum, ventral view; 14, vulva, dorsal view. Scale bars: 10, 0.5 mm; 11-14, 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female (from Jianfengling Mountain), total length 2.30 : prosoma 0.80 long, 0.70 wide; 1.45 long, 1.30 wide.
Color. Legs yellow. Venter gray yellow brown. Other characters as in male.

Prosoma. AER recurved and PER recurved lightly from dorsal view. Eye measurements: AME 0.06 , ALE 0.08 , PME 0.08 , PLE 0.08 ; AME–AME 0.08 , AME–ALE 0.03 , ALE–ALE 0.43 , PME–PME 0.08 , PME–PLE 0.05 , PLE–PLE 0.42 , ALE and PLE contiguous. MOA long 0.20 , front width 0.19 , back width 0.21 . Clypeus height 0.14 . Labium 0.14 long, 0.18 wide. Sternum 0.55 long, 0.50 wide.

Female genitalia (
Figs
13 – 14
). Epigynum slightly sclerotized, copulatory opening lying between two posterior atria; spermathecae oval; copulatory ducts thin and short, connected with spermathecae posteriorly.

Variation. Coloration of opisthosoma of both sexes ranges from gray yellow to dark gray; some specimens had a darker median stripe anteriorly and posteriorly, and some with darker median stripe wholly; leg coloration ranges from yellow brown to brownish. Male total body length varies from
1.69 – 1.79
and female from
2.10 – 2.30
.

Comments.
A. seximaculatum
was originally placed in the genus
Theridion
and described from Hainan Island, based on three females. During the examination of the specimens collected from Hainan Island in
2007 – 2009
, we found some pairs of male and female specimens collected in the same locality and date; these females were identified as
A. seximaculatum
. We consider the associated males as conspecific. We have described the male of this species here for the first time. The characters of this species fit the
Anelosimus
diagnosis and circumscription, namely, the dorsum of abdomen with a dark notched longitudinal central band edged by a narrow white band, and the bilateral white blotches distributed outside the dorsal band ( Figs 1, 2 , 7 , 10 ,
15
); colulus replaced by a pair of setae; entire conductor; three palpal tibial trichobothria and robust femora I ( Agnarsson 2004 , 2006). Thus we transfer here
T. seximaculatum
to the genus
Anelosimus
.
